elements.title: Thalamocortical transcriptional gates coordinate memory stabilization
elements.contents:
Thalamocortical transcriptional gates coordinate memory stabilization

The sequential recruitment of a thalamocortical transcriptional cascade enables memory maintenance over long timescales.

  • Andrea Terceros
  • Celine Chen
  • Priya Rajasethupathy
Article26 Nov 2025

elements.title: NSD2 targeting reverses plasticity and drug resistance in prostate cancer
elements.contents:
NSD2 targeting reverses plasticity and drug resistance in prostate cancer

Inhibition of the histone methyltransferase NSD2 and the androgen receptor in preclinical models can reverse lineage plasticity to suppress tumour growth and promote cell death in multiple subtypes of castration-resistant prostate cancer.

  • Jia J. Li
  • Alessandro Vasciaveo
  • Michael M. Shen
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Ferroelectric transistors for low-power NAND flash memory
elements.contents:
Ferroelectric transistors for low-power NAND flash memory

Ultralow-power ferroelectric field-effect transistors are used to achieve low-power NAND flash memory, overcoming the trade-off between multi-level capability and power efficiency and paving the way for next-generation storage memory.

  • Sijung Yoo
  • Taek Jung Kim
  • Duk-Hyun Choe
Article26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Building compositional tasks with shared neural subspaces
elements.contents:
Building compositional tasks with shared neural subspaces

The brain can flexibly perform multiple tasks by compositionally combining task-relevant neural representations.

  • Sina Tafazoli
  • Flora M. Bouchacourt
  • Timothy J. Buschman
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Slipknot-gauged mechanical transmission and robotic operation
elements.contents:
Slipknot-gauged mechanical transmission and robotic operation

A mechano-intelligent transmission mechanism based on the slipknot delivers precise force signals for clinical practice and robotic operations such as minimally invasive surgery and tendon-driven robotics.

  • Yaoting Xue
  • Jiasheng Cao
  • Xiujun Cai
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Vicarious body maps bridge vision and touch in the human brain
elements.contents:
Vicarious body maps bridge vision and touch in the human brain

A mode of brain organization that connects visual and bodily reference frames may translate raw sensory impressions into more abstract formats that are useful for action, social cognition and semantic processing.

  • Nicholas Hedger
  • Thomas Naselaris
  • Tomas Knapen
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Multi-qubit nanoscale sensing with entanglement as a resource
elements.contents:
Multi-qubit nanoscale sensing with entanglement as a resource

Controlling pairs of nitrogen vacancy centres enables the measurement of magnetic correlations below the optical diffraction limit, and the use of entangled pairs shows a linear scaling of the measurement sensitivity with readout noise, as opposed to the quadratic scaling that would be obtained with unentangled spins.

  • Jared Rovny
  • Shimon Kolkowitz
  • Nathalie P. de Leon
Article26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Ethylene modulates cell wall mechanics for root responses to compaction
elements.contents:
Ethylene modulates cell wall mechanics for root responses to compaction

Soil compaction traps ethylene around roots, which causes transcriptional upregulation of Auxin Response Factor1, resulting in decreased root cortical cell wall thickness and thereby promoting root radial expansion.

  • Jiao Zhang
  • Zengyu Liu
  • Staffan Persson
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: iHALT unlocks liver functionality as a surrogate secondary lymphoid organ
elements.contents:
iHALT unlocks liver functionality as a surrogate secondary lymphoid organ

Liver-restricted viral infection in mice results in secondary lymphoid organ dormancy and the compensatory induction of specialized lymphoid tissue in the liver, the structural features and functional outputs of which are closely mirrored in humans.

  • John Gridley
  • David Pak
  • Arash Grakoui
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Inhibitory PD-1 axis maintains high-avidity stem-like CD8+ T cells
elements.contents:
Inhibitory PD-1 axis maintains high-avidity stem-like CD8+ T cells

PD-1 blockade interferes with the selective expansion and maintenance of high-affinity TCR stem-like clones that have a critical role in effective checkpoint blockade therapy.

  • Jyh Liang Hor
  • Edward C. Schrom
  • Ronald N. Germain
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Inhibitors supercharge kinase turnover through native proteolytic circuits
elements.contents:
Inhibitors supercharge kinase turnover through native proteolytic circuits

Inhibitor-induced kinase degradation is a common event that positions supercharging of endogenous degradation circuits as an alternative to classical proximity-inducing degraders.

  • Natalie S. Scholes
  • Martino Bertoni
  • Georg E. Winter
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Ancient DNA from Shimao city records kinship practices in Neolithic China
elements.contents:
Ancient DNA from Shimao city records kinship practices in Neolithic China

Sequencing of 144 ancient genomes from Shimao city and its satellites presents pedigrees among tomb owners spanning up to four generations showing predominantly patrilineal descent structure across Shimao communities, and possibly sex-specific sacrificial rituals.

  • Zehui Chen
  • Jacob D. Gardner
  • Qiaomei Fu
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: New finds shed light on diet and locomotion in Australopithecus deyiremeda
elements.contents:
New finds shed light on diet and locomotion in Australopithecus deyiremeda

3.4-million-year-old hominin fossils discovered in Ethiopia provide insight into the diet and locomotion of Australopithecus deyiremeda.

  • Yohannes Haile-Selassie
  • Gary T. Schwartz
  • Naomi E. Levin
ArticleOpen Access26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Evolution of taste processing shifts dietary preference
elements.contents:
Evolution of taste processing shifts dietary preference

Calcium imaging of taste neurons and the ventral brain provides insight into evolutionary divergence of food choice in Drosophila species, supporting a role of sensorimotor processing in addition to peripheral receptor changes.

  • Enrico Bertolini
  • Daniel Münch
  • Thomas O. Auer
Article26 Nov 2025

elements.title: No meta-analytical effect of economic inequality on well-being or mental health
elements.contents:
No meta-analytical effect of economic inequality on well-being or mental health

A meta-analysis of 168 studies reveals that economic inequality is not significantly associated with subjective well-being or mental health.

  • Nicolas Sommet
  • Adrien A. Fillon
  • Annahita Ehsan
Article26 Nov 2025

elements.title: Land-use change undermines the stability of avian functional diversity
elements.contents:
Land-use change undermines the stability of avian functional diversity

Large-scale analyses of bird species traits reveal that land-use change reduces resilience of key ecological functions more than previously thought.

  • Thomas L. Weeks
  • Patrick A. Walkden
  • Joseph A. Tobias
